result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura M. Raymond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laura M. Raymond in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Laura M. Raymond.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Asking for 60 days, State does not object. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waiver of Extradition- Illinois- Signed
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Laura M. Raymond in court, in custody.  Attorney Josh Ryan for Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Laura M. Raymond.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Ryan, granted. Modified to $1000 cash, same conditions. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bond

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Laura M. Raymond in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Laura M. Raymond. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Grace Haggerman for Obi Uzowulu. ADA Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Atty Haggerman. ADA Herrmann objects. Bond motion denied. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM (64-06) Defendant Laura M. Raymond appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Berg in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Laura M. Raymond. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives her right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open court. 
Defense acknowledged the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client. 
Speedy reserved.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Initial appearance scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Laura M Raymond in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for defendant. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Motion to modify bond by defense, state objects. Argument, bond remains. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Laura M Raymond in court, in custody by video. James Sempf for the State of Wisconsin. Grace Haggerman for defendant. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Bond set over the weekend, State has not yet made charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
